snippet: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention urged caution for Ebola survivors after a man might have passed the virus to his partner months after recovering from it.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says survivors of Ebola should abstain from sex or use condoms indefinitely until more is known, rather than three months previously recommended; statement is revision of CDC's guidelines on transmission of virus, prompted by case of woman who may have contracted disease from having sex with Liberian man who had recovered from infection many months earlier.
lead_paragraph: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention urged caution for Ebola survivors after a man might have passed the virus to his partner months after recovering from it.
